title: Prawn Saganaki

ingredients.content: 1 - 2 fresh red chillies, halved, deseeded if desired, to taste
2 - 3 sprigs fresh parsley, leaves only, to taste, plus extra for garnishing
240 g tinned cherry tomatoes, drained (1 x 400 g tin)
400 g large raw prawns, peeled, deveined

preparations.content: Place garlic, chillies, parsley, onions and oil in mixing bowl then chop <b>5 sec/speed 7<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then sauté <b>5 min/100°C/speed 1<b>.
Add tomatoes, passata, wine, salt and pepper then, with simmering basket in place of measuring cup, cook <b>8 min/100°C//speed 1<b>. Meanwhile, preheat grill to 200°C.
Add prawns and mix by hand with spatula. Transfer to a baking dish (approx. 30 cm x 20 cm) and scatter over feta. Grill for 3-5 minutes (200°C) until feta is slightly browned and prawns are cooked.
Garnish with extra parsley and lemon wedges, then serve immediately with crusty bread.

hintsAndTricks: Transport yourself to a beautiful, sun-drenched Greek island with this prawn dish that’s bursting with flavour. Plump, juicy prawns are grilled in a rich tomato sauce and topped with crumbled feta, fresh parsley and plenty of freshly-squeezed lemon juice. The only thing needed is some crusty bread to soak it all up.
